posts.content:
Mouse has been part of our family for nearly 8 years now, we all love her but as our children are getting older its time for her to find a new family to get out and enjoy her as she does like to get out and about!

She left the factory in 1964 and was shipped to Los Angeles where she stayed till the 90's when she moved down to Florida, her last owner in the States was a bit of a hippy, he gave her a crazy vinyl wrap and she was used regularly as his church bus (there's still pencilled phone numbers on the van interior)

We bought her from RvTech,who had found her in Florida and imported her back to the UK, John, the owner was a real help sorting out all the import paperwork and getting the wrap removed as it just wasn't for us

Minor restoration time now!!

New lower nose panel -Schofield
2 new cab doors -US rust free imports
Loading door sill- KlassicFab, this was before they started importing, it took a lot of time to get the best!!
lots more bits including new glass from Schofield's (all in history file)
finally a respray in Blauweiss (L289) over Turkis (L380), then it was time for the interior, we fitted units based on Canterbury Pitt and Devon designs and used original Devon sourced parts as well, with the red gingham seat pads matching the deluxe trim infill its all good

mechanically mouse is sound, always checked by my mechanic, passed last mot with no problems,
1600cc engine was fitted at some point while in the US along with a cool Hurst quick-shift with a glittery gear knob lifted from the 1970's
she pulls real well, steering and brakes are sound, as a ride, shes far better than the 1970's bay window we had before

bad bits, some corrosion around lower front windows as it had safari's fitted when new and a couple of stone chips on body as she gets used regularly in the summer months, also the red deluxe infill is beginning to discolour, was going to replace but will leave it to the new owner to decide on red or the original green

Â£20,000

link to pics of her now, how she looked in the states when we bought her and some pics of the resto

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/yhvwig1ijatl ... 6U0La?dl=0

Van is in Northwich, Cheshire, please contact me at jeanpaulfrancois@live,co.uk
hi can i get a contact number cheers mark 07932636601
